Description: Nile silt pottery bowl with flat base, flaring sides and rounded rim; coated on interior with red slip and burnished. The exterior rim is coated with slip but not burnished; the rest of the exterior is untreated. Exterior shows traces of smoke discolouration. Base bears potmark incised post-firing involving one vertical stroke crossed by two horizontal strokes.
Curator's comments: Marked B on the side. Polished red ware P22A in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair; body cracked, rim worn from use.
